content:
Sure, here is a table that represents the 16 geomancy figures using squares and includes their descriptions and interpretations in separate columns:

| Figure | Name | Description | Interpretation |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| ■■■■ | Populus | Four dots arranged in a square | The people, the common folk, crowds, masses, social events, groups |
| ■ ■ | Via | Two dots separated by a line | A journey, a path, movement, progress, transitions, changes |
| ■■ | Albus | Two dots at the top, one at the bottom | Purification, clarity, spiritual matters, wisdom, insight |
| ■ | Coniunctio | One dot above, one below, joined by a line | Union, connection, partnership, marriage, relationships |
| ■■■ | Puella | Three dots at the top, one at the bottom | Feminine energy, beauty, grace, romance, creativity |
| ■ ■■ | Fortuna Major | One dot at the top, three at the bottom | Good fortune, success, prosperity, growth, abundance |
| ■■■ | Caput Draconis | Three dots in a vertical line | The head of the dragon, beginnings, birth, new projects, leadership |
| ■■ ■■ | Puer | Two sets of two dots arranged in squares | Masculine energy, action, adventure, passion, courage |
| ■ ■■ | Rubeus | One dot at the top, two at the bottom, arranged in a line | Emotions, passion, anger, stress, conflict, chaos |
| ■■ | Acquisitio | One dot at the top, two at the bottom, arranged in a triangle | Acquisition, gain, growth, material possessions, wealth |
| ■ ■■ | Laetitia | Two dots at the top, one at the bottom, arranged in a line | Joy, happiness, celebration, optimism, positivity |
| ■■■■■ | Cauda Draconis | Five dots arranged in a cross | The tail of the dragon, endings, completion, transformation, letting go |
| ■■■ ■ | Fortuna Minor | Two dots at the top, one at the bottom, arranged in a triangle | Minor fortune, temporary success, small gains, progress |
| ■ ■■■ | Tristitia | One dot at the top, two at the bottom, arranged in a triangle | Sadness, grief, depression, loss, disappointment |
| ■■ ■ | Conjunctio | Two dots at the top, one at the bottom, arranged in a line | Union, connection, partnership, marriage, relationships |
| ■ ■ | Carcer | Two dots separated by a horizontal line | Confinement, restriction, obstacles, blockages, imprisonment |

I hope this is helpful!
